review_title: Great place to work if you're a nurse, otherwise be cautious
job_title: in Mount Kisco, NY
pros: Health Benefits are great. They offer generous tuition reimbursement if you want to go to school.  There is a building next door where they offer cheap housing only to hospital employees.  A friendly community of co-workers that all know eachother.
cons: No communication from management.  You might physically see your boss once every 4 months.  And the only reason that they'll bother to talk to you is to tell you what you're doing wrong.  Promotions are based on favoritism, not merit or seniority.

review_title: My time as a Volunteer with the Chef and Staff
job_title: Volunteer in Mount Kisco, NY
pros: I loved my time as a Volunteer at Northern Westchester Hospital I worked in the kitchen with the Chef, Cooks, Cooks Helper, Action Station, Dishwasher and More i did a lot in the kitchen from peeling Potatoes, Making Sandwiches, and prep for the Action Station I would want anyone who wants to work in Culinary Field should Volunteer in the kitchen you get to work with Chef Patty and Chris and the rest of the Staff.
cons: I had so much fun there that time goes by fast

job_title: Patient Care Associate in Chester, NY
pros: Loved working with the nurses, loved working for the patients, They constantly educating. I got my CPR through them. I was in the middle of getting my Telemetry certification. I loved working with all the employees.
cons: One day changed my life. I hurt myself during my shift. needed therapy and now I can not lift people anymore. Im looking for a less physical demanding job.

review_title: Pleasant experience for myself aside from regular workplace B.S. that you have to deal with everywhere.
job_title: Emergency Department Technician in Mount Kisco, NY
pros: They will educate and train you to do clinical tasks that other hospitals might require you to already be certified in prior to getting an interview.
cons: You don't have much of a say when it comes to how the job is done.  Even when you have great insight, management tends to overlook your concerns and do what they thi k is best.

job_title: RN in Mount Kisco, NY
pros: flexible schedules,warm atmosphere, competent staff. This hospital really worked with me when I needed to take some time off. They really did go above and beyond to help me keep my job.
cons: Understaffed, lower wages than surrounding hospitals. Overall, the hospital is probably comparable to most other places.

job_title: Ultrasound Technologist in New York, NY
